page.title: 14Transport in Silverdale
page.content: An unclassified road runs parallel to the coastline ending at Brown's Houses which are almost on the shore. It is used by the the inhabitants of the few houses along its length, and in the summer by holiday makers visiting Jack Scout and the shore at Jenny Brown's Point. The unclassified road between Silverdale and Carnforth just crosses the north-east corner of the review area. The railway line between Preston and Barrow-in-Furness also runs across the same corner. It is raised about 2.5 metres to guard against flooding. There are goods and passenger services, including the carriage of nuclear waste.
